title.narrative: Technical Assistance - United States-Indo-Pacific Standards and Technology Cooperation Program Technical Assistance, through American National Standards Institute

description.narrative: USTDA funding is supporting the U.S.-Indo-Pacific Standards and Technology Cooperation Program (STCP), a series of 12 separate and distinct standards-focused workshops to be held in different countries throughout the Indo-Pacific region. The STCP is designed to support the Indo-Pacific Strategy by facilitating engagement between U.S. and Indo-Pacific industry and government representatives to ensure that decision-makers who develop and implement standards, testing protocols, and regulatory procedures in the region are informed of internationally accepted industry-led standards.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Trade and Development Agency

The STCP is designed to support the Indo-Pacific Strategy by facilitating engagement between U.S. and Indo-Pacific industry and government representatives to ensure that decision-makers who develop and implement standards, testing protocols, and regulatory procedures in the region are informed of internationally accepted industry-led standards.

title.narrative: Southeast Asia Aviation Workshop Series, through Futron Corporation

description.narrative: USTDA funding is supporting a series of six (6) Southeast Asia Aviation Workshops to provide a broad range of managerial, technical, safety, efficiency, capacity, and operational training to key officials from civil aviation authorities, airport management groups, air navigation providers, and individual airport operators in Southeast Asia. The workshops serve as a forum where representatives from U.S. industry and government engage Southeast Asian counterparts to collaborate on best practices, standards, and policy development for the region's aviation industry.

title.narrative: Airport Checkpoint Design RTM, through National US Arab Chamber Of Commerce (Inc)

description.narrative: This USTDA-funded reverse trade mission (RTM) will support the travel of Indo-Pacific aviation security officials and airport representatives to attend the Transportation Security Administration (TSA) International Design Symposium in the United States. The RTM will familiarize delegates with TSA airport checkpoint design requirements and best practices and introduce delegates to U.S. aviation security technologies.

title.narrative: Reverse Trade Mission - United States-Southeast Asia Aviation Cooperation Program Reverse Trade Mission Series, through National US Arab Chamber Of Commerce (Inc)

description.narrative: This Reverse Trade Mission (RTM) series will support two separate and distinct RTMs to the United States in support of the U.S.- Southeast Asia Aviation Cooperation Program (ACP). The RTMs will bring up to 30 public and private aviation sector representatives from Southeast Asia and potentially Pacific Island countries to the United States to familiarize delegates with U.S. aviation best practices, equipment, and technology, and will discuss topics such as aviation safety during the COVID-19 pandemic.

title.narrative: Orientation Visit - ASEAN 5G Ecosystem RTM Series, through Business Council for International Understanding

description.narrative: The 5G Ecosystem Reverse Trade Mission (RTM) Series consists of three separate missions designed to familiarize decision makers from Malaysia, Thailand and Vietnam with U.S. technologies and use cases for 5G wireless networks. The missions will build awareness of the potential applications and enabling regulatory environment that can accelerate 5G rollout and the enhanced security implications. The RTM delegations will travel to up to three cities in the United States for meetings with public and private sector representatives and relevant site visits.

title.narrative: Workshop Series - United States-Southeast Asia Aviation Cooperation Program Workshop Series Phase II, through Futron Corporation

description.narrative: USTDA funding would support a series of four (4) workshops to provide a broad range of managerial, technical, safety, efficiency, capacity, and operational training to key officials from civil aviation authorities, airlines, air navigation providers, and/or individual airport operators in Southeast Asia and Pacific Islands. The U.S.-Southeast Asia Aviation Cooperation Program Workshops Series Phase II would serve as a forum where representatives from U.S. industry and government engage Southeast Asian and Pacific Island counterparts to collaborate on best practices, standards, and policy development for the regions aviation industry. USTDA funding is enabling the U.S. Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) to deliver technical content and program support for the USTDA-funded U.S.-Southeast Asia Aviation Cooperation Program Workshop Series Phase II. The workshops aim to facilitate engagement on key topics in aviation between government and industry representatives from the United States, Southeast Asia, and the Pacific Islands.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Reverse Trade Mission - Southeast Asia Climate-Smart Transportation Reverse Trade Mission (RTM), through Tavaci Partners, LLC

description.narrative: This reverse trade mission (RTM) brings delegates from Indonesia, Laos, Malaysia, the Philippines, Thailand, and Vietnam to the United States to familiarize them with state-of-the-art U.S. technologies, services, and best practices to improve the safety, efficiency, and sustainability of transportation infrastructure. The RTM focuses on innovations that can support the decarbonization of the transportation sector, particularly at the city level, in Southeast Asia.

title.narrative: Workshop Series - Southeast Asia Healthcare Workshop Series, through Blueprint Creative Group

description.narrative: USTDA funding is supporting a series of six (6) Southeast Asia Healthcare Workshops to provide a broad range of policy focused education and training to healthcare stakeholders from Southeast Asian countries, with an emphasis on USTDA's priority markets: Indonesia, Malaysia, Philippines, Thailand, and Vietnam. The workshops will serve as a forum where representatives from U.S. industry and government can engage Southeast Asian counterparts to collaborate on best practices, laws, regulations, standards, and policy development for the region's healthcare industry.

title.narrative: Reverse Trade Mission - Smart Grid Technologies Reverse Trade Mission, through Business Council for International Understanding

description.narrative: This USTDA-funded reverse trade mission (RTM) series will bring delegates from Malaysia, the Philippines, and Vietnam to the United States to familiarize them with state-of-the-art U.S. technologies, services, and best practices to improve the safety, efficiency, and sustainability of smart grid infrastructure. The Malaysia and Philippines RTMs will primarily focus on advanced grid solutions and renewable energy integration, while the Vietnam RTM will primarily focus on grid cybersecurity solutions.

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - Association of Southeast Asian Nations Interconnections Feasibility Study, through Delphos International, Ltd.

description.narrative: This grant funds a feasibility study (FS) for PT Perusahaan Listrik Negara (PLN), Indonesia's state-owned power utility, to develop an interconnected cross-border power system with the aim of increasing system flexibility through effective resource sharing and utilization and would help advance ASEAN clean energy goals. The Study would determine the technical, financial, and economic feasibility of two electrical power interconnections between Indonesia and Malaysia.
